dialogue1.0.phrases1: *A muffled voice coming out of the wall* \n\nWould there be a friendly ear ready to listen to me? I have a very interesting deal to offer you?

dialogue1.1.phrases1: I don't feel like wasting my time talking to a wall, so I appreciated an answer!

dialogue2.0.phrases1: *Talking to the wall* Who are you?
dialogue2.0.phrases2:
Ah, finally an intelligent being! 

Hello brave people, my name is Stale and I, like you, am currently being held against my will in the jail next door. 
I could use a little help to get out of this situation. 

Would you be so kind as to help me?
dialogue2.0.phrases3: *Lauching then whisper*\nIt's so funny the way he talks.

dialogue3.0.phrases1: Okay, we'll help you out. But I'm not sure I can do much from our cell.
dialogue3.0.phrases2: Excellent! \nI have access to the mechanism of your gaol. \nI should be able to open it easily and once you're outside you can just open mine with a steamilles.

dialogue4.0.phrases2: Steamille: Female name, small pill-like object. Miniaturized steam reserve. Manufactured mainly in FactoryTech. \n\nYou should be able to find them quite easily, given that we are in the plant in question.

dialogue5.0.phrases1: Sorry, I'm not working. There's something fishy down there.
dialogue5.0.phrases2: *Stale sighs* Know that if I have to do without your help, I will be forced to risk the lives of all the people around me!

dialogue6.0.phrases1:
Well, the plan is very simple. 
Once the entrance to your jail is open, you scan the area for steam. 

Once this task is accomplished, all you have to do is use it to free me. Good luck with that.

Poof! 
Who says you're not locked up for a reason? 
 
You're a little too polite to be honest!
dialogue8.0.phrases2: That's an excellent point! But it also applies to you. You could be bloody killers with no faith or law... \nSo I fear, my dear, that we should not trust each other to get out of this bad step.
